children.name: footer_type
children.label: What type of footer would you like?
children.help_text: If you'd like to set up a bunch of navigation links in the footer, definitely go with FULL.  The MINIMAL option will on show your logo, copyright, social icons, and legal links.

children.name: num_cols
children.label: How many columns do you want?

children.name: two_col_arrangement
children.label: Column Arrangement
children.help_text: If you have the footer type set too MINIMAL, disregard this option.

children.name: three_col_arrangement
children.label: Column Arrangement
children.help_text: If you have the footer type set too MINIMAL, disregard this option.

children.name: four_col_arrangement
children.label: Column Arrangement
children.help_text: If you have the footer type set too MINIMAL, disregard this option.

children.name: translate
children.label: Add Translated Elements:
children.help_text: This is a legacy feature prior to HubSpot releasing the ability to use Smart Rules with custom modules.  A Smart Rule is the preferred way to translate your modules.
children.inline_help_text: Recommended: Use HubSpot Smart Rule instead of this feature.

children.name: default_lang_url
children.label: Set Default Language URL abbreviation (Website/Landing Pages):)
children.help_text: This will need to be the same default language that you have set up in your content settings.  In most cases, this is going to be English (en) in which you won't need to edit this.

children.name: default_lang_url_blog
children.label: Set Default Language URL abbreviation (Blog)
children.help_text: In many cases, you won't need to adjust this if your blog is in English. In some cases, the "language code" that's generated for the blog may be different than what is set on the website page.

children.name: collapse_foot
children.label: Collapse Footer Columns on Mobile
children.inline_help_text: This prevents your footer from being SUPER tall if you have a ton of links.

children.name: menu_default
children.label: Legal Menu (Default):
children.help_text: This menu is intended to be only one level. Adding "child nav items" will make things look super funky.

children.name: add_disclaimer_row
children.label: Add Disclaimer Row
children.inline_help_text: This adds a full column at the very bottom for any additional text you might need.

children.name: lang_url
children.label: What is the Language's URL abbreviation? (EX: fr for French)
children.help_text: This is an important step to get right.  You can find the Language URL when creating any translated page once you've selected the Language.

children.name: menu_translated
children.label: Legal Menu (Translated):
children.help_text: This menu is intended to be only one level. Adding "child nav items" will make things look super funky.

children.name: col_type
children.label: What would you like in this column?
children.inline_help_text: Note: If page speed is important it is best not to use the form or blog post option.

children.name: blog
children.label: Select blog to pull post from:

children.name: tag
children.label: Select Tag to pull post from:
children.inline_help_text: Only applicable if "Tag" option is selected above.

children.name: submit_alt
children.label: Use Submit Button Alternative Style:
children.inline_help_text: This is the alternative style that you can set from your Theme Settings.

children.help_text: This is an important step to get right.  You can find the Language URL when creating any translated page once you've selected the Language.

children.name: telegram_url
children.label: Telegram URL
children.inline_help_text: Leave blank to hide the icon.

children.name: tiktok_url
children.label: Tiktok URL
children.inline_help_text: Leave blank to hide the icon.

children.name: discord_url
children.label: Discord URL
children.inline_help_text: Leave blank to hide the icon.

children.name: pinterest_url
children.label: Pinterest URL
children.inline_help_text: Leave blank to hide the icon.

children.name: bg_color
children.label: Background Color:
children.help_text: Please use a solid color.

children.name: bg_color_1
children.label: Gradient Color 1:
children.help_text: Please use a solid color.

children.name: bg_color_2
children.label: Gradient Color 2:
children.help_text: Please use a solid color.

children.name: custom_icon_color
children.label: Give social icons a custom color:
children.help_text: If you'd like to give the social icons a different color than the global default, turn this puppy on.

children.name: post_feat_img_height
children.label: Post Featured Image Height (if it applies)
children.help_text: Use this slider to set the appropriate height according to the standard size and ratio of your featured images. PRO-TIP:  Keep all your featured images the same size. This will make everything looks super-doper CLEAN.

children.name: line_color
children.label: Horizontal Line Color:
children.help_text: Please use a solid color.

children.name: back_to_top_color
children.label: Back to Top Color:
children.help_text: This will adjust the color of the circle. Don't worry about setting an opacity (%). This will happen automatically.

children.name: test
children.label: Test:
children.inline_help_text: This is currently a test. Please disregard.

children.name: section_id
children.label: CSS ID:
children.help_text: This is great when you want to create anchor links that zips someone to a certain section of the page.  There must be no spaces in the ID you choose. Use a dash (-) or underscore (_) instead.

children.name: section_class
children.label: CSS Class:
children.help_text: This is helpful if you know just enough of CSS to be dangerous.  Make sure that class names don't have spaces.
